lesson.title: The Word of Life
lesson.summary: The Bible brings us the living Christ; touch Scripture inwardly with your spirit to receive life.

points.point: The Bible is unique — the Word of life.
Outward (mind) vs. inward (spirit) touching of Scripture.
Open the Bible to meet the Lord Himself.

lesson.practice: Pray-read John 1:1: “O Lord — the Word is life to me.”

lesson.title: Coming to the Word to “Taste” the Lord
lesson.summary: We taste Christ by drinking the milk of the Word and eating every word from God.

points.point: The Word is milk and bread for growth.
Do not take the Bible as mere knowledge; it is life to be eaten.
Eating the Word becomes joy and strength within.

lesson.practice: Read one verse; whisper “Amen” after each phrase.

lesson.title: Pray-reading the Word
lesson.summary: Prepare your heart, then receive the Word by all prayer; the words become Spirit and life.

points.point: Confess and enter fellowship before reading.
Pray the Scripture itself; many ways to pray-read.
When words meet prayer, they become Spirit and life.

lesson.practice: Keep eyes on the text; turn each line into short prayers.

lesson.title: The Bible Being God’s Breathing Out
lesson.summary: Scripture is God’s breathing out; our prayer is breathing in. Come to the Bible to come to Jesus.

points.point: Read prayerfully to breathe in what God has breathed out.
God’s words are food; eating gives life.
The Bible is one with the Lord; come to Him for life.

lesson.practice: Breathe in rhythm while reading: inhale “God-breathed,” exhale “life in me.”

lesson.title: Learning to Pray-read with Our Spirit
lesson.summary: Let Christ’s words abide in you by pray-reading; this fills you with the Spirit and produces song.

points.point: Christ abides as His words abide in us.
Strike the Word at the right spot (our spirit) — then fire!
Filled with the Word, we sing with grace.

lesson.practice: Pray-read John 15:7 three times, then sing a short praise.

lesson.title: The Inward Washing of the Water
lesson.summary: The Word becomes the Spirit in us, washing and transforming us from within over time.

points.point: Filled with the Word → inward washing removes spots and wrinkles.
Christ settles in our heart; love and clarity grow.

lesson.practice: Muse a verse for 2 minutes; say “Amen” to let the water flow.
